Greenland ice core measurements of unique chemical tracers of fires are also consistent with a decrease in fire emissions since the PI (see Supplementary Figure 1 and Supplementary Table 1). We note that CO measurements in Antarctic ice cores
7 also suggest that PI fire emissions are higher over the Southern Hemisphere than are currently estimated in inventories. Although the measured quadrupling of the enhancement in PI CO from fires cannot be reproduced from PD fire distributions
6 , a significant change in fire emissions from nearby regions such as Patagonia and Australia (such as shown within the fire modelling presented here) could significantly enhance PI CO from fires transported to Antarctica.
